title: The Good Shepherd Quiz
description: Test your understanding of Jesus as the Good Shepherd

questions.text: What does Jesus call Himself in John 10?
questions.explanation: Jesus identifies Himself as the Good Shepherd who cares for His sheep.

options.explanation: Correct! Jesus calls Himself the Good Shepherd.
While Jesus is the King of Kings, in this passage He calls Himself the Good Shepherd.
Jesus is the Light of the World, but in John 10 He focuses on being the Good Shepherd.

questions.text: Jesus says His sheep hear His voice and follow Him.
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that His followers know and respond to His voice.

options.explanation: Correct! Jesus said 'My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.'
This statement is true according to John 10:27.

title: David's Courage Quiz
description: Learn about David's faith when facing Goliath

questions.text: Why was David confident he could defeat Goliath?
questions.explanation: David's confidence came from his trust in God's power and past faithfulness.

options.explanation: Correct! David said 'The Lord who delivered me from the paw of the lion and from the paw of the bear will deliver me from the hand of this Philistine.'

options.text: He was very tall and strong
options.explanation: David was actually young and smaller than Goliath. His strength came from God.
David used only a simple sling and stone. His confidence was in God, not weapons.
